jhelp.util.io

Class UtilIO

  • java.lang.Object
    • jhelp.util.io.UtilIO

  • public final class UtilIO
extends java.lang.Object
    Utilities for Input/Output streams
    Author:
    JHelp

                                                 throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                                        java.io.IOException
        Compute the SHA code of a stream
        Parameters:
        inputStream - Stream to read
        Returns:
        SHA code
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - If SHA not implemented (Should never append, its java base algorithm)
        java.io.IOException - On reading issue

      • isVirtualLink

        public static boolean isVirtualLink(java.io.File file)
        Indicates if a file is a virtual link.
        A virtual link in Linux system is a way to have a reference to a file/directory as if it is in place, but the real file is other place. It is a way to share the same file by several directory
        Parameters:
        file - File to test
        Returns:
        true if it is a virtual link

        The file

      • readStream

        public static int readStream(java.io.InputStream inputStream,
             byte[] array)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Read stream and fill an array.
        The write in array start at begin.
        It stop to read stream if stream reach its end or the array is full.
        Do same as readStream(inputStream, array, 0, array.length)
        Parameters:
        inputStream - Stream to read
        array - Array to fill
        Returns:
        Number of bytes read (It can be less than array length if stream have not enough data to fill totaly the array)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - On reading issue

      • readStream

        public static int readStream(java.io.InputStream inputStream,
             byte[] array,
             int offset)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Read stream and fill an array.
        The write in array start at the offset specify.
        It stop to read stream if stream reach its end or the array is full
        Do same as readStream(inputStream, array, offset, array.length - offset)
        Parameters:
        inputStream - Stream to read
        array - Array to fill
        offset - To start writing
        Returns:
        Number of bytes read (It can be less than array length if stream have not enough data to fill totaly the array)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - On reading issue

      • readStream

        public static int readStream(java.io.InputStream inputStream,
             byte[] array,
             int offset,
             int length)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Read stream and fill an array.
        The write in array start at the offset specify.
        It stop to read stream if stream reach its end or the specify length is reach
        Parameters:
        inputStream - Stream to read
        array - Array to fill
        offset - To start writing
        length - Number of bytes to read at maximum
        Returns:
        Number of bytes read (It can be less than specify length if stream have not enough data to respect the length)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - On reading issue

      • writeByteArray

        public static void writeByteArray(byte[] array,
                  java.io.OutputStream outputStream)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Write an array on stream.
        Same as writeByteArray(array, 0, array.length, outputStream)
        Parameters:
        array - Array to write
        outputStream - Stream where write
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - On writing issue

      • writeDouble

               java.io.OutputStream outputStream)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Write double in a stream
        Parameters:
        d - Double to write
        outputStream - Stream where write
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - On writing problem

      • zip

        public static void zip(java.io.File source,
       java.io.File destination)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Zip a file or directory inside a file
        Parameters:
        source - File/directory to zip
        destination - File destination
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - On zipping issue
